job_tasks.justification: Executing test plans is a fundamental part of the software development lifecycle, ensuring the quality of the developed software.
Identifying and reporting bugs is a core software development activity to ensure product quality and facilitate fixes.

job_tasks.phrase: collaborate with our development team to resolve issues
job_tasks.justification: Collaboration with the development team to resolve issues is a standard part of the software development process.

job_tasks.phrase: create and implement comprehensive test plans
job_tasks.justification: Creating and implementing test plans is a key activity in ensuring the quality of software development.
Performing manual and automated tests is a crucial part of the software development process to ensure functionality and stability.
Reporting test findings is an integral part of the software development process to communicate quality status.
Regression testing is a software development practice to ensure new changes haven't adversely affected existing functionality.
Documenting and reporting test results is essential for tracking progress and ensuring the quality of software.
Providing feedback for continuous improvement is a common practice in software development to enhance processes and outcomes.
Participating in code reviews is a software development activity aimed at improving code quality and sharing knowledge.

job_tasks.phrase: provide input on quality assurance standards and processes
job_tasks.justification: Providing input on quality assurance standards and processes is part of ensuring robust software development practices.

job_tasks.phrase: Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in software testing
job_tasks.justification: While focused on testing, this implies understanding the tools and technologies within the software development ecosystem.

classification.rationale: The job description focuses entirely on Quality Assurance (QA) and testing, with no mention of generative AI, LLMs, or related technologies. The tasks and skills described are standard for a traditional QA Engineer role, not an AI-focused engineering position.
